Rules.SettingName: V-220697 - Require Windows Enterprise x64

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220697 - Domain-joined systems must use Windows 10 Enterprise Edition 64-bit version.
RemediationStrings.Description: Use Windows 10 Enterprise 64-bit version for domain-joined systems.

Rules.SettingName: V-220698 - TPM Enabled & Ready

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220698 - Windows 10 domain-joined systems must have a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) enabled and ready for use.
RemediationStrings.Description:
For standalone or nondomain-joined systems, this is NA.

Virtualization-based security, including Credential Guard, currently cannot be implemented in VDI due to specific supporting requirements including a TPM, UEFI with Secure Boot, and the capability to run the Hyper-V feature within the virtual desktop.

For VDIs where the virtual desktop instance is deleted or refreshed upon logoff, this is NA.

Ensure domain-joined systems have a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) that is configured for use. (Versions 2.0 or 1.2 support Credential Guard.)

The TPM must be enabled in the firmware.

Run "tpm.msc" for configuration options in Windows.

Rules.SettingName: V-220699 - Use UEFI

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220699 - Windows 10 systems must have Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) firmware and be configured to run in UEFI mode, not Legacy BIOS.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure UEFI firmware to run in UEFI mode, not Legacy BIOS mode.

Rules.SettingName: V-220701-NoChk - Flaw Remediation

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220701 - Windows 10 must employ automated mechanisms to determine the state of system components with regard to flaw remediation using the following frequency: continuously, where ESS is used; 30 days, for any additional internal network scans not covered by ESS; and annually, for external scans by Computer Network Defense Service Provider (CNDSP).
RemediationStrings.Description: Install DoD-approved ESS software and ensure it is operating continuously.

Rules.SettingName: V-220702 - Use Bitlocker

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220702 - Windows 10 information systems must use BitLocker to encrypt all disks to protect the confidentiality and integrity of all information at rest.
RemediationStrings.Description:
Enable full disk encryption on all information systems (including SIPRNet) using BitLocker.

BitLocker, included in Windows, can be enabled in the Control Panel under "BitLocker Drive Encryption" as well as other management tools.

NOTE: An alternate encryption application may be used in lieu of BitLocker providing it is configured for full disk encryption and satisfies the pre-boot authentication requirements (WN10-00-000031 and WN10-00-000032).

Rules.SettingName: V-220703 - Use Bitlocker Startup PIN

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220703 - Windows 10 systems must use a BitLocker PIN for pre-boot authentication.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> BitLocker Drive Encryption >> Operating System Drives "Require additional authentication at startup" to "Enabled" with "Configure TPM Startup PIN:" set to "Require startup PIN with TPM" or with "Configure TPM startup key and PIN:" set to "Require startup key and PIN with TPM".

Rules.SettingName: V-220704 - Minimum Bitlocker PIN length

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220704 - Windows 10 systems must use a BitLocker PIN with a minimum length of six digits for pre-boot authentication.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> BitLocker Drive Encryption >> Operating System Drives "Configure minimum PIN length for startup" to "Enabled" with "Minimum characters:" set to "6" or greater.

Rules.SettingName: V-220705-NoChk - Application Allowlist

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220705 - The operating system must employ a deny-all, permit-by-exception policy to allow the execution of authorized software programs.
RemediationStrings.Description:
Configure an application allowlisting program to employ a deny-all, permit-by-exception policy to allow the execution of authorized software programs.

Configuration of allowlisting applications will vary by the program. AppLocker is an allowlisting application built into Windows 10 Enterprise.

If AppLocker is used, it is configured through group policy in Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Application Control Policies >> AppLocker.

Implementation guidance for AppLocker is available at the following link:

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/windows-defender-application-control/applocker/applocker-policies-deployment-guide

Rules.SettingName: V-220709 - No Alternate OS

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220709 - Alternate operating systems must not be permitted on the same system.
RemediationStrings.Description: Ensure Windows 10 is the only operating system on a device.  Remove alternate operating systems.

Rules.SettingName: V-220710-NoChk - Limit Non-system Share Access

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220710 - Non system-created file shares on a system must limit access to groups that require it.
RemediationStrings.Description:
If a non system-created share is required on a system, configure the share and NTFS permissions to limit access to the specific groups or accounts that require it.

Remove any unnecessary non-system created shares.

Rules.SettingName: V-220713 - Limit Backup Operators Members

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220713 - Only accounts responsible for the backup operations must be members of the Backup Operators group.
RemediationStrings.Description: Create separate accounts for backup operations for users with this privilege.

Rules.SettingName: V-220714 - Limit Hyper-V Administrators Members

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220714 - Only authorized user accounts must be allowed to create or run virtual machines on Windows 10 systems.
RemediationStrings.Description:
For Hyper-V, remove any unauthorized groups or user accounts from the "Hyper-V Administrators" group.

For hosted hypervisors other than Hyper-V, restrict access to create or run virtual machines to authorized user accounts only.

Rules.SettingName: V-220716 - Require Password Expiration

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220716 - Accounts must be configured to require password expiration.
RemediationStrings.Description:
Configure all passwords to expire.
Run "Computer Management".
Navigate to System Tools >> Local Users and Groups >> Users.
Double click each active account.
Ensure "Password never expires" is not checked on all active accounts.

Rules.SettingName: V-220717 - System Directories Permissions

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220717 - Permissions for system files and directories must conform to minimum requirements.
RemediationStrings.Description: Maintain the default file system permissions and configure the Security Option: "Network access: Let everyone permissions apply to anonymous users" to "Disabled" (WN10-SO-000160).

Rules.SettingName: V-220719 - No SNMP Installed

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220719 - Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) must not be installed on the system.
RemediationStrings.Description:
Uninstall "Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP)" from the system.

Run "Programs and Features".
Select "Turn Windows Features on or off".
De-select "Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP)".

Rules.SettingName: V-220720 - No Simple Tcp/Ip Installed

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220720 - Simple TCP/IP Services must not be installed on the system.
RemediationStrings.Description:
Uninstall "Simple TCPIP Services (i.e. echo, daytime etc)" from the system.

Run "Programs and Features".
Select "Turn Windows Features on or off".
De-select "Simple TCPIP Services (i.e. echo, daytime etc)".

Rules.SettingName: V-220721 - No Telnet Installed

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220721 - The Telnet Client must not be installed on the system.
RemediationStrings.Description:
Uninstall "Telnet Client" from the system.

Run "Programs and Features".
Select "Turn Windows Features on or off".

De-select "Telnet Client".

Rules.SettingName: V-220722 - No TFTP Installed

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220722 - The TFTP Client must not be installed on the system.
RemediationStrings.Description:
Uninstall "TFTP Client" from the system.

Run "Programs and Features".
Select "Turn Windows Features on or off".

De-select "TFTP Client".

Rules.SettingName: V-220723 - No Cert Installation Files

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220723 - Software certificate installation files must be removed from Windows 10.
RemediationStrings.Description:
Remove any certificate installation files (*.p12 and *.pfx) found on a system.

Note: This does not apply to server-based applications that have a requirement for .p12 certificate files (e.g., Oracle Wallet Manager) or Adobe PreFlight certificate files.

Rules.SettingName: V-220724 - Use Firewall

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220724 - A host-based firewall must be installed and enabled on the system.
RemediationStrings.Description: Install and enable a host-based firewall on the system.

Rules.SettingName: V-220725-NoChk - Firewall Inbound Exceptions

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220725 - Inbound exceptions to the firewall on Windows 10 domain workstations must only allow authorized remote management hosts.
RemediationStrings.Description:
Configure firewall exceptions to inbound connections on domain workstations to include only authorized remote management hosts.

Configure only inbound connection exceptions for authorized remote management hosts.
Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Windows Defender Firewall with Advanced Security >> Windows Defender Firewall with Advanced Security >> Inbound Rules (this link will be in the right pane)

For any inbound rules that allow connections, configure the Scope for Remote IP address to those of authorized remote management hosts. This may be defined as an IP address, subnet or range. Apply the rule to all firewall profiles.

If a third-party firewall is used, configure inbound exceptions to only include authorized remote management hosts.

Rules.SettingName: V-220728 - Disable PowerShell V2

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220728 - The Windows PowerShell 2.0 feature must be disabled on the system.
RemediationStrings.Description:
Disable "Windows PowerShell 2.0" on the system.

Run "Windows PowerShell" with elevated privileges (run as administrator).
Enter the following:
Disable-WindowsOptionalFeature -Online -FeatureName MicrosoftWindowsPowerShellV2Root

This command should disable both "MicrosoftWindowsPowerShellV2Root" and "MicrosoftWindowsPowerShellV2" which correspond to "Windows PowerShell 2.0" and "Windows PowerShell 2.0 Engine" respectively in "Turn Windows features on or off".

Alternately:
Search for "Features".
Select "Turn Windows features on or off".
De-select "Windows PowerShell 2.0".

Rules.SettingName: V-220729 - Disable SMBv1 Protocol

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220729 - The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the system.
RemediationStrings.Description:
Disable the SMBv1 protocol.

Run "Windows PowerShell" with elevated privileges (run as administrator).

Enter the following:
Disable-WindowsOptionalFeature -Online -FeatureName SMB1Protocol

Alternately:
Search for "Features".

Select "Turn Windows features on or off".

De-select "SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support".

Rules.SettingName: V-220730 - Disable SMBv1 Server

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220730 - The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB server.
RemediationStrings.Description:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "Configure SMBv1 Server" to "Disabled".

This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.   

The system must be restarted for the change to take effect.

Rules.SettingName: V-220731 - Disable SMBv1 Client

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220731 - The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB client.
RemediationStrings.Description:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "Configure SMBv1 client driver" to "Enabled" with "Disable driver (recommended)" selected for "Configure MrxSmb10 driver".

This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.   

The system must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

Rules.SettingName: V-220732 - Disable Secondary Logon

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220732 - The Secondary Logon service must be disabled on Windows 10.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the "Secondary Logon" service "Startup Type" to "Disabled".

Rules.SettingName: V-220733-NoChk - Remove Orphaned SIDs

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220733 - Orphaned security identifiers (SIDs) must be removed from user rights on Windows 10.
RemediationStrings.Description: Remove any unresolved SIDs found in User Rights assignments and determined to not be for currently valid accounts or groups by removing the accounts or groups from the appropriate group policy.

Rules.SettingName: V-220734-NoChk - Bluetooth Turned Off Unless Approved

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220734 - Bluetooth must be turned off unless approved by the organization.
RemediationStrings.Description: Turn off Bluetooth radios not organizationally approved. Establish an organizational policy for the use of Bluetooth.

Rules.SettingName: V-220735-NoChk - Bluetooth Turned Off When Not in Use

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220735 - Bluetooth must be turned off when not in use.
RemediationStrings.Description: Turn off Bluetooth radios when not in use. Establish an organizational policy for the use of Bluetooth to include training of personnel.

Rules.SettingName: V-220736-NoChk - Bluetooth Notify When Device Attempts Connect

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220736 - The system must notify the user when a Bluetooth device attempts to connect.
RemediationStrings.Description:
Configure Bluetooth to notify users if devices attempt to connect.
View Bluetooth Settings.
Ensure "Alert me when a new Bluetooth device wants to connect" is checked.

Rules.SettingName: V-220738-NoChk - Nonpersistent VM Session Limit

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220738 - Windows 10 nonpersistent VM sessions must not exceed 24 hours.
RemediationStrings.Description: Set nonpersistent VM sessions to not exceed 24 hours.

Rules.SettingName: V-220739 - Configure Account Lockout Duration

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220739 - Windows 10 account lockout duration must be configured to 15 minutes or greater.
RemediationStrings.Description:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Account Lockout Policy >> "Account lockout duration" to "15" minutes or greater.

A value of "0" is also acceptable, requiring an administrator to unlock the account.

Rules.SettingName: V-220740 - Configure Failed Logon Attempts

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220740 - The number of allowed bad logon attempts must be configured to 3 or less.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Account Lockout Policy >> "Account lockout threshold" to "3" or less invalid logon attempts (excluding "0" which is unacceptable).

Rules.SettingName: V-220741 - Configure Bad Logon Counter Reset

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220741 - The period of time before the bad logon counter is reset must be configured to 15 minutes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Account Lockout Policy >> "Reset account lockout counter after" to "15" minutes.

Rules.SettingName: V-220742 - Configure Password History

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220742 - The password history must be configured to 24 passwords remembered.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Enforce password history" to "24" passwords remembered.

Rules.SettingName: V-220743 - Configure Max Password Age

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220743 - The maximum password age must be configured to 60 days or less.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Maximum Password Age" to "60" days or less (excluding "0" which is unacceptable).

Rules.SettingName: V-220744 - Configure Min Password Age

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220744 - The minimum password age must be configured to at least 1 day.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Minimum Password Age" to at least "1" day.

Rules.SettingName: V-220745 - Configure Min Password Length

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220745 - Passwords must, at a minimum, be 14 characters.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Minimum password length" to "14" characters.

Rules.SettingName: V-220746 - Configure Password Complexity

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220746 - The built-in Microsoft password complexity filter must be enabled.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Password must meet complexity requirements" to "Enabled".

Rules.SettingName: V-220748 - Audit Account Logon - Credential Validation - Failure

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220748 - The system must be configured to audit Account Logon - Credential Validation failures.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Logon >> "Audit Credential Validation" with "Failure" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220749 - Audit Account Logon - Credential Validation - Success

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220749 - The system must be configured to audit Account Logon - Credential Validation successes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Logon >> "Audit Credential Validation" with "Success" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220750 - Audit Account Management - Security Group Management - Success

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220750 - The system must be configured to audit Account Management - Security Group Management successes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Management >> "Audit Security Group Management" with "Success" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220751 - Audit Account Management - User Account Management - Failure

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220751 - The system must be configured to audit Account Management - User Account Management failures.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Management >> "Audit User Account Management" with "Failure" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220752 - Audit Account Management - User Account Management - Success

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220752 - The system must be configured to audit Account Management - User Account Management successes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Management >> "Audit User Account Management" with "Success" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220753 - Audit Detailed Tracking - PnP Activity - Success

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220753 - The system must be configured to audit Detailed Tracking - PNP Activity successes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Detailed Tracking >> "Audit PNP Activity" with "Success" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220754 - Audit Detailed Tracking - Process Creation - Success

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220754 - The system must be configured to audit Detailed Tracking - Process Creation successes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Detailed Tracking >> "Audit Process Creation" with "Success" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220755 - Audit Logon/Logoff - Account Lockout - Failure

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220755 - The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Account Lockout failures.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Account Lockout" with "Failure" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220756 - Audit Logon/Logoff - Group Membership - Success

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220756 - The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Group Membership successes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Group Membership" with "Success" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220757 - Audit Logon/Logoff - Logoff - Success

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220757 - The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Logoff successes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Logoff" with "Success" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220758 - Audit Logon/Logoff - Logon - Failure

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220758 - The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Logon failures.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Logon" with "Failure" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220759 - Audit Logon/Logoff - Logon - Success

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220759 - The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Logon successes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Logon" with "Success" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220760 - Audit Logon/Logoff - Special Logon - Success

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220760 - The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Special Logon successes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Special Logon" with "Success" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220761 - Audit Object Access - File Share - Failure

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220761 - Windows 10 must be configured to audit Object Access - File Share failures.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Object Access >> "Audit File Share" with "Failure" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220762 - Audit Object Access - File Share - Success

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220762 - Windows 10 must be configured to audit Object Access - File Share successes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Object Access >> "Audit File Share" with "Success" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220763 - Audit Object Access - Other Object Access Events - Success

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220763 - Windows 10 must be configured to audit Object Access - Other Object Access Events successes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Object Access >> "Audit Other Object Access Events" with "Success" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220764 - Audit Object Access - Other Object Access Events - Failure

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220764 - Windows 10 must be configured to audit Object Access - Other Object Access Events failures.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Object Access >> "Audit Other Object Access Events" with "Failure" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220765 - Audit Object Access - Removable Storage - Failure

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220765 - The system must be configured to audit Object Access - Removable Storage failures.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Object Access >> "Audit Removable Storage" with "Failure" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220766 - Audit Object Access - Removable Storage - Success

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220766 - The system must be configured to audit Object Access - Removable Storage successes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Object Access >> "Audit Removable Storage" with "Success" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220767 - Audit Policy Change - Audit Policy Change - Success

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220767 - The system must be configured to audit Policy Change - Audit Policy Change successes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Policy Change >> "Audit Audit Policy Change" with "Success" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220768 - Audit Policy Change - Authentication Policy Change - Success

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220768 - The system must be configured to audit Policy Change - Authentication Policy Change successes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Policy Change >> "Audit Authentication Policy Change" with "Success" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220769 - Audit Policy Change - Authorization Policy Change - Success

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220769 - The system must be configured to audit Policy Change - Authorization Policy Change successes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Policy Change >> "Audit Authorization Policy Change" with "Success" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220770 - Audit Privilege Use - Sensitive Privilege Use - Failure

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220770 - The system must be configured to audit Privilege Use - Sensitive Privilege Use failures.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Privilege Use >> "Audit Sensitive Privilege Use" with "Failure" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220771 - Audit Privilege Use - Sensitive Privilege Use - Success

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220771 - The system must be configured to audit Privilege Use - Sensitive Privilege Use successes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Privilege Use >> "Audit Sensitive Privilege Use" with "Success" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220772 - Audit System - IPSec Driver - Failure

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220772 - The system must be configured to audit System - IPSec Driver failures.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> "Audit IPSec Driver" with "Failure" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220773 - Audit System - Other System Events - Success

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220773 - The system must be configured to audit System - Other System Events successes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> "Audit Other System Events" with "Success" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220774 - Audit System - Other System Events - Failure

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220774 - The system must be configured to audit System - Other System Events failures.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> "Audit Other System Events" with "Failure" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220775 - Audit System - Security State Change - Success

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220775 - The system must be configured to audit System - Security State Change successes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> "Audit Security State Change" with "Success" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220776 - Audit System - Security System Extension - Success

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220776 - The system must be configured to audit System - Security System Extension successes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> "Audit Security System Extension" with "Success" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220777 - Audit System - System Integrity - Failure

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220777 - The system must be configured to audit System - System Integrity failures.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> "Audit System Integrity" with "Failure" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220778 - Audit System - System Integrity - Success

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220778 - The system must be configured to audit System - System Integrity successes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> "Audit System Integrity" with "Success" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220779 - Configure Application Event Log Size

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220779 - The Application event log size must be configured to 32768 KB or greater.
RemediationStrings.Description:
If the system is configured to send audit records directly to an audit server, this is NA.  This must be documented with the ISSO.

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Event Log Service >> Application >> "Specify the maximum log file size (KB)" to "Enabled" with a "Maximum Log Size (KB)" of "32768" or greater.

Rules.SettingName: V-220780 - Configure Security Event Log Size

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220780 - The Security event log size must be configured to 1024000 KB or greater.
RemediationStrings.Description:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Event Log Service >> Security >> "Specify the maximum log file size (KB)" to "Enabled" with a "Maximum Log Size (KB)" of "1024000" or greater.

If the system is configured to send audit records directly to an audit server, documented with the ISSO.

Rules.SettingName: V-220781 - Configure System Event Log Size

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220781 - The System event log size must be configured to 32768 KB or greater.
RemediationStrings.Description:
If the system is configured to send audit records directly to an audit server, this is NA.  This must be documented with the ISSO.

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Event Log Service >> System >> "Specify the maximum log file size (KB)" to "Enabled" with a "Maximum Log Size (KB)" of "32768" or greater.

Rules.SettingName: V-220782 - Configure Application Event Log ACL

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220782 - Windows 10 permissions for the Application event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.
RemediationStrings.Description:
Ensure the permissions on the Application event log (Application.evtx) are configured to prevent standard user accounts or groups from having access. The default permissions listed below satisfy this requirement.

Eventlog - Full Control
SYSTEM - Full Control
Administrators - Full Control

The default location is the "%SystemRoot%\SYSTEM32\WINEVT\LOGS" directory.

If the location of the logs has been changed, when adding Eventlog to the permissions, it must be entered as "NT Service\Eventlog".

Rules.SettingName: V-220783 - Configure Security Event Log ACL

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220783 - Windows 10 permissions for the Security event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.
RemediationStrings.Description:
Ensure the permissions on the Security event log (Security.evtx) are configured to prevent standard user accounts or groups from having access.  The default permissions listed below satisfy this requirement.

Eventlog - Full Control
SYSTEM - Full Control
Administrators - Full Control

The default location is the "%SystemRoot%\SYSTEM32\WINEVT\LOGS" directory.

If the location of the logs has been changed, when adding Eventlog to the permissions, it must be entered as "NT Service\Eventlog".

Rules.SettingName: V-220784 - Configure System Event Log ACL

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220784 - Windows 10 permissions for the System event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.
RemediationStrings.Description:
Ensure the permissions on the System event log (System.evtx) are configured to prevent standard user accounts or groups from having access. The default permissions listed below satisfy this requirement.

Eventlog - Full Control
SYSTEM - Full Control
Administrators - Full Control

The default location is the "%SystemRoot%\SYSTEM32\WINEVT\LOGS" directory.

If the location of the logs has been changed, when adding Eventlog to the permissions, it must be entered as "NT Service\Eventlog".

Rules.SettingName: V-220786 - Audit Other Policy Change Events - Failure

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220786 - Windows 10 must be configured to audit Other Policy Change Events Failures.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Policy Change>> "Audit Other Policy Change Events" with "Failure" selected.

RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Other Logon/Logoff Events" with "Success" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220788 - Audit Other Logon/Logoff - Failure

RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Other Logon/Logoff Events" with "Failure" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220789 - Audit Detailed File Share - Failure

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220789 - Windows 10 must be configured to audit Detailed File Share Failures.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Object Access >> Audit Detailed File Share" with "Failure" selected.

Rules.SettingName: V-220790 - Audit MPSSVC Rule-Level Policy Change - Success

RemediationStrings.Title: V-220790 - Windows 10 must be configured to audit MPSSVC Rule-Level Policy Change Successes.
RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Policy Change >> Audit MPSSVC Rule-Level Policy Change" with "Success" selected.

RemediationStrings.Description: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Policy Change >> Audit MPSSVC Rule-Level Policy Change" with "Failure" selected.
